abstract: Federal advisory panel says boys and young men should be vaccinated against human papillomavirus to protect against anal and throat cancers that can result from sexual activity; recommendation by panel, Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices of the Centers for Disease Control, is likely to transform use of HPV vaccine, which has been until now suggested for young girls.
snippet: The vaccine will protect against cancers that can result from sexual activity, a federal advisory committee said.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

lead_paragraph: The vaccine will protect against cancers that can result from sexual activity, a federal advisory committee said.

headline.main: Panel Endorses HPV Vaccine for Boys of 11
headline.print_headline: Panel Endorses HPV Vaccine For Boys of 11
headline.seo: Panel Recommends HPV Vaccine for Boys and Young Men
